info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 1:54PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF EASTERN ALBANY...WESTERN GREENE...SCHOHARIE...AND WESTERN ALBANY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 153 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from Colonie to near Breakabeen and moving southeast at 30 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Albany, Watervliet, Colonie, Delmar, Guilderland and Loudonville around 200 PM EST. Menands around 205 PM EST. Windham and Preston Hollow around 220 PM EST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 6 and 24. Interstate 87 between exits 23 and 2. Interstate 787 near exit 1, and between exits 5 and 7. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
